informal_statement:
What is the value of  $(3x - 2)(4x + 1) - (3x - 2)4x + 1$ when $x=4$?

$\mathrm{(A)}\ 0
\qquad\mathrm{(B)}\ 1
\qquad\mathrm{(C)}\ 10
\qquad\mathrm{(D)}\ 11
\qquad\mathrm{(E)}\ 12$ Show that it is \mathrm{(D)}\ 11.
formal_statement:
theorem amc12b_2002_p2:
  fixes x ::int
  assumes h0: "x = 4" 
  shows "(3 * x - 2) * (4 * x + 1) - (3 * x - 2) * (4 * x) + 1 = 11"
formal_code:
(*
  Authors: Wenda Li
*)

theory amc12b_2002_p2
  imports Complex_Main 
begin

theorem amc12b_2002_p2:
  fixes x ::int
  assumes h0: "x = 4" 
  shows "(3 * x - 2) * (4 * x + 1) - (3 * x - 2) * (4 * x) + 1 = 11"
  using assms by simp

end
